trans-unit.source: Operations on DocumentDB Document Collections
trans-unit.target: Operations on DocumentDB Document Collections

trans-unit.source: Operations on DocumentDB Document Collections
trans-unit.target: Operations on DocumentDB Document Collections

trans-unit.source: The DocumentDB API supports basic CRUD operations on the resources under a database account.
trans-unit.target: The DocumentDB API supports basic CRUD operations on the resources under a database account.

trans-unit.source: A collection is a container of JSON documents and associated JavaScript application logic, i.e. stored procedures, triggers and user-defined functions.
trans-unit.target: A collection is a container of JSON documents and associated JavaScript application logic, i.e. stored procedures, triggers and user-defined functions.

trans-unit.source: This topic outlines the REST operations used to manage DocumentDB document collections.
trans-unit.target: This topic outlines the REST operations used to manage DocumentDB document collections.

trans-unit.source: Since a collection is a system resource, it has a fixed schema.
trans-unit.target: Since a collection is a system resource, it has a fixed schema.

trans-unit.source: A collection's URI path is represented by <legacyBold><legacyItalic>colls</legacyItalic></legacyBold> in the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB resource model</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: A collection's URI path is represented by <legacyBold><legacyItalic>colls</legacyItalic></legacyBold> in the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB resource model</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of a collection:
trans-unit.target: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of a collection:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: id
trans-unit.target: id

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is a user settable property.
trans-unit.target: This is a user settable property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique name that identifies a collection, i.e. no two collections share the same <legacyBold>id</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique name that identifies a collection, i.e. no two collections share the same <legacyBold>id</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> must not exceed 255 characters.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> must not exceed 255 characters.

trans-unit.source: _rid
trans-unit.target: _rid

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.
trans-unit.target: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.

trans-unit.source: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the collection resource.
trans-unit.target: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the collection resource.

trans-unit.source: _ts
trans-unit.target: _ts

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.
trans-unit.target: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.

trans-unit.source: The value is a timestamp.
trans-unit.target: The value is a timestamp.

trans-unit.source: _self
trans-unit.target: _self

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.

trans-unit.source: _etag
trans-unit.target: _etag

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.

trans-unit.source: _doc
trans-unit.target: _doc

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the documents resource.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the documents resource.

trans-unit.source: _sprocs
trans-unit.target: _sprocs

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the stored procedures (sprocs) resource.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the stored procedures (sprocs) resource.

trans-unit.source: _triggers
trans-unit.target: _triggers

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the triggers resource.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the triggers resource.

trans-unit.source: _udfs
trans-unit.target: _udfs

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the user-defined functions (udfs) resource.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the user-defined functions (udfs) resource.

trans-unit.source: _conflicts
trans-unit.target: _conflicts

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the conflicts resource.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the conflicts resource.

trans-unit.source: During an operation on a resource within a collection, if a conflict occurs, users can inspect the conflicting resources by performing a GET on the conflicts URI path.
trans-unit.target: During an operation on a resource within a collection, if a conflict occurs, users can inspect the conflicting resources by performing a GET on the conflicts URI path.

trans-unit.source: indexingPolicy
trans-unit.target: indexingPolicy

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is the indexing policy setting for the collection.
trans-unit.target: This is the indexing policy setting for the collection.

trans-unit.source: All properties in the <legacyBold>indexingPolicy</legacyBold> are user settable.
trans-unit.target: All properties in the <legacyBold>indexingPolicy</legacyBold> are user settable.

trans-unit.source: Properties in Indexing Policy
trans-unit.target: Properties in Indexing Policy

trans-unit.source: automatic
trans-unit.target: automatic

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>True</parameterReference> indicates that automatic indexing is on; otherwise, <parameterReference>False</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>True</parameterReference> indicates that automatic indexing is on; otherwise, <parameterReference>False</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: The default value is <parameterReference>True</parameterReference>, thus all documents are indexed by default.
trans-unit.target: The default value is <parameterReference>True</parameterReference>, thus all documents are indexed by default.

trans-unit.source: Documents can be excluded by specifying the <legacyBold>x-ms-indexingdirective</legacyBold> header value to “Exclude”.
trans-unit.target: Documents can be excluded by specifying the <legacyBold>x-ms-indexingdirective</legacyBold> header value to “Exclude”.

trans-unit.source: Setting the value to <parameterReference>False</parameterReference> allows no documents are indexed.
trans-unit.target: Setting the value to <parameterReference>False</parameterReference> allows no documents are indexed.

trans-unit.source: Documents can be included by specifying the <legacyBold>x-ms-indexingdirective</legacyBold> header value to “Include”.
trans-unit.target: Documents can be included by specifying the <legacyBold>x-ms-indexingdirective</legacyBold> header value to “Include”.

trans-unit.source: indexingMode
trans-unit.target: indexingMode

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The acceptable values are <parameterReference>consistent</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>lazy</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: The acceptable values are <parameterReference>consistent</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>lazy</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: By default, the indexing mode is <parameterReference>consistent</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: By default, the indexing mode is <parameterReference>consistent</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: This means that indexing occurs synchronously during insertion, replacement or deletion of documents, and queries are served at the same consistency level as configured in the request.
trans-unit.target: This means that indexing occurs synchronously during insertion, replacement or deletion of documents, and queries are served at the same consistency level as configured in the request.

trans-unit.source: To have indexing occur asynchronously, set the indexing mode to <parameterReference>lazy</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: To have indexing occur asynchronously, set the indexing mode to <parameterReference>lazy</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: With lazy indexing, the index is updated when the collection is operating below its request units per second capacity.
trans-unit.target: With lazy indexing, the index is updated when the collection is operating below its request units per second capacity.

trans-unit.source: IncludePaths
trans-unit.target: IncludePaths

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The array containing the document paths to be indexed.
trans-unit.target: The array containing the document paths to be indexed.

trans-unit.source: All properties are user settable.
trans-unit.target: All properties are user settable.

trans-unit.source: By default, two paths are included: the <parameterReference>/</parameterReference> path denoting all document paths are indexed, and the <parameterReference>_ts</parameterReference> path denoting indexing for timestamp range comparisons.
trans-unit.target: By default, two paths are included: the <parameterReference>/</parameterReference> path denoting all document paths are indexed, and the <parameterReference>_ts</parameterReference> path denoting indexing for timestamp range comparisons.

trans-unit.source: indexType
trans-unit.target: indexType

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The acceptable values are <parameterReference>Hash</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: The acceptable values are <parameterReference>Hash</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>Hash</parameterReference> indexes are useful for equality comparisons while <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> indexes are useful for range comparison.
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>Hash</parameterReference> indexes are useful for equality comparisons while <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> indexes are useful for range comparison.

trans-unit.source: At the moment, range indexes can only be used for numeric values.
trans-unit.target: At the moment, range indexes can only be used for numeric values.

trans-unit.source: The default value is <parameterReference>Hash</parameterReference> for document paths and <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> for a _ts path.
trans-unit.target: The default value is <parameterReference>Hash</parameterReference> for document paths and <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> for a _ts path.

trans-unit.source: NumericPrecision
trans-unit.target: NumericPrecision

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The acceptable values are 1 to 7.
trans-unit.target: The acceptable values are 1 to 7.

trans-unit.source: The default value is 3.
trans-unit.target: The default value is 3.

trans-unit.source: This is the byte precision value for numeric values.
trans-unit.target: This is the byte precision value for numeric values.

trans-unit.source: The higher this value is set, the lower the probability of term collision, resulting in a faster and more accurate comparison.
trans-unit.target: The higher this value is set, the lower the probability of term collision, resulting in a faster and more accurate comparison.

trans-unit.source: However, the higher the value the greater the storage overhead.
trans-unit.target: However, the higher the value the greater the storage overhead.

trans-unit.source: StringPrecision
trans-unit.target: StringPrecision

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The acceptable values are 1 to 7.
trans-unit.target: The acceptable values are 1 to 7.

trans-unit.source: The default value is 3.
trans-unit.target: The default value is 3.

trans-unit.source: This is the byte precision value for strings.
trans-unit.target: This is the byte precision value for strings.

trans-unit.source: The higher this value is set, the lower the probability of term collision, resulting in a faster and more accurate comparison.
trans-unit.target: The higher this value is set, the lower the probability of term collision, resulting in a faster and more accurate comparison.

trans-unit.source: However, the higher the value the greater the storage overhead.
trans-unit.target: However, the higher the value the greater the storage overhead.

trans-unit.source: Path
trans-unit.target: Path

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The accepted value is a valid document path including wildcards value of ?
trans-unit.target: The accepted value is a valid document path including wildcards value of ?

trans-unit.source: and *.
trans-unit.target: and *.

trans-unit.source: ExcludePaths
trans-unit.target: ExcludePaths

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The array containing the document paths to be excluded from indexing.
trans-unit.target: The array containing the document paths to be excluded from indexing.

trans-unit.source: All properties are user settable.
trans-unit.target: All properties are user settable.

trans-unit.source: Property of the Exclude Paths
trans-unit.target: Property of the Exclude Paths

trans-unit.source: Path
trans-unit.target: Path

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The accepted value is a valid document path including wildcards values of ?
trans-unit.target: The accepted value is a valid document path including wildcards values of ?

trans-unit.source: and *.
trans-unit.target: and *.

trans-unit.source: Indexing Policy
trans-unit.target: Indexing Policy

trans-unit.source: As documents are added to a collection, DocumentDB by default automatically indexes the documents, thus allowing documents to be queried.
trans-unit.target: As documents are added to a collection, DocumentDB by default automatically indexes the documents, thus allowing documents to be queried.

trans-unit.source: It is at the collection level that you configure the indexing policy.
trans-unit.target: It is at the collection level that you configure the indexing policy.

trans-unit.source: Since indexing policy is set at the collection level, each collection within a database can have different indexing policies.
trans-unit.target: Since indexing policy is set at the collection level, each collection within a database can have different indexing policies.

trans-unit.source: The indexing policy for a collection can specify the following options:
trans-unit.target: The indexing policy for a collection can specify the following options:

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Automatic:</legacyBold> You can choose if you want the collection to automatically index all documents or not.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Automatic:</legacyBold> You can choose if you want the collection to automatically index all documents or not.

trans-unit.source: By default, all documents are automatically indexed, but you can choose to turn it off.
trans-unit.target: By default, all documents are automatically indexed, but you can choose to turn it off.

trans-unit.source: When indexing is turned off, documents can be accessed only through their self-links or by queries using ID.
trans-unit.target: When indexing is turned off, documents can be accessed only through their self-links or by queries using ID.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Indexing Mode:</legacyBold> You can choose between synchronous (Consistent) and asynchronous (Lazy) index updates.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Indexing Mode:</legacyBold> You can choose between synchronous (Consistent) and asynchronous (Lazy) index updates.

trans-unit.source: By default, the index is updated synchronously on each insertion, replacement, or deletion action taken on a document in the collection.
trans-unit.target: By default, the index is updated synchronously on each insertion, replacement, or deletion action taken on a document in the collection.

trans-unit.source: This enables the queries to honor the same consistency level as that of the document reads without any delay for the index to catch up.
trans-unit.target: This enables the queries to honor the same consistency level as that of the document reads without any delay for the index to catch up.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Index types and precision:</legacyBold> The type or scheme used for index entries has a direct impact on index storage and performance.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Index types and precision:</legacyBold> The type or scheme used for index entries has a direct impact on index storage and performance.

trans-unit.source: For a scheme using higher precision, queries are typically faster.
trans-unit.target: For a scheme using higher precision, queries are typically faster.

trans-unit.source: However, there is also a higher storage overhead for the index.
trans-unit.target: However, there is also a higher storage overhead for the index.

trans-unit.source: Choosing a lower precision means that more documents might have to be processed during query execution, but the storage overhead will be lower.
trans-unit.target: Choosing a lower precision means that more documents might have to be processed during query execution, but the storage overhead will be lower.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Index paths:</legacyBold> Within documents, you can choose which paths must be included or excluded from indexing.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Index paths:</legacyBold> Within documents, you can choose which paths must be included or excluded from indexing.

trans-unit.source: This can offer improved write performance and lower index storage for scenarios when the query patterns are known beforehand.
trans-unit.target: This can offer improved write performance and lower index storage for scenarios when the query patterns are known beforehand.

trans-unit.source: Examples of Indexing paths:
trans-unit.target: Examples of Indexing paths:

trans-unit.source: The following tables shows some sample indexing paths and how they are used within queries.
trans-unit.target: The following tables shows some sample indexing paths and how they are used within queries.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Default path for collection.
trans-unit.target: Default path for collection.

trans-unit.source: Recursive and applies to whole document tree.
trans-unit.target: Recursive and applies to whole document tree.

trans-unit.source: /"prop"/?
trans-unit.target: /"prop"/?

trans-unit.source: Index path required to serve queries like the following (with Hash or Range types respectively):
trans-unit.target: Index path required to serve queries like the following (with Hash or Range types respectively):

trans-unit.source: SELECT * FROM collection c WHERE c.prop = "value"
trans-unit.target: SELECT * FROM collection c WHERE c.prop = "value"

trans-unit.source: SELECT * FROM collection c WHERE c.prop > 5
trans-unit.target: SELECT * FROM collection c WHERE c.prop > 5

trans-unit.source: /"prop"/*
trans-unit.target: /"prop"/*

trans-unit.source: Index path for all paths under the specified label.
trans-unit.target: Index path for all paths under the specified label.

trans-unit.source: Works with the following queries
trans-unit.target: Works with the following queries

trans-unit.source: SELECT * FROM collection c WHERE c.prop = "value"
trans-unit.target: SELECT * FROM collection c WHERE c.prop = "value"

trans-unit.source: SELECT * FROM collection c WHERE c.prop.subprop > 5
trans-unit.target: SELECT * FROM collection c WHERE c.prop.subprop > 5

trans-unit.source: SELECT * FROM collection c WHERE c.prop.subprop.nextprop = "value"
trans-unit.target: SELECT * FROM collection c WHERE c.prop.subprop.nextprop = "value"

trans-unit.source: Index path required to serve iteration and JOIN queries against arrays of scalars like ["a", "b", "c"]:
trans-unit.target: Index path required to serve iteration and JOIN queries against arrays of scalars like ["a", "b", "c"]:

trans-unit.source: SELECT tag FROM tag IN collection.props WHERE tag = "value"
trans-unit.target: SELECT tag FROM tag IN collection.props WHERE tag = "value"

trans-unit.source: SELECT tag FROM collection c JOIN tag IN c.props WHERE tag > 5
trans-unit.target: SELECT tag FROM collection c JOIN tag IN c.props WHERE tag > 5

trans-unit.source: /"props"/[]/"subprop"/?
trans-unit.target: /"props"/[]/"subprop"/?

trans-unit.source: Index path required to serve iteration and JOIN queries against arrays of objects like [{subprop: "a"}, {subprop: "b"}]:
trans-unit.target: Index path required to serve iteration and JOIN queries against arrays of objects like [{subprop: "a"}, {subprop: "b"}]:

trans-unit.source: SELECT tag FROM tag IN collection.props WHERE tag.subprop = "value"
trans-unit.target: SELECT tag FROM tag IN collection.props WHERE tag.subprop = "value"

trans-unit.source: SELECT tag FROM collection c JOIN tag IN c.props WHERE tag.subprop = "value"
trans-unit.target: SELECT tag FROM collection c JOIN tag IN c.props WHERE tag.subprop = "value"

trans-unit.source: /"prop"/"subprop"/
trans-unit.target: /"prop"/"subprop"/

trans-unit.source: Index path used during query execution to prune documents that do not have the specified path.
trans-unit.target: Index path used during query execution to prune documents that do not have the specified path.

trans-unit.source: /"prop"/"subprop"/?
trans-unit.target: /"prop"/"subprop"/?

trans-unit.source: Index path required to serve queries (with Hash or Range types respectively):
trans-unit.target: Index path required to serve queries (with Hash or Range types respectively):

trans-unit.source: SELECT * FROM collection c WHERE c.prop.subprop = "value"
trans-unit.target: SELECT * FROM collection c WHERE c.prop.subprop = "value"

trans-unit.source: SELECT * FROM collection c WHERE c.prop.subprop > 5
trans-unit.target: SELECT * FROM collection c WHERE c.prop.subprop > 5

trans-unit.source: Default path for collection.
trans-unit.target: Default path for collection.

trans-unit.source: Recursive and applies to whole document tree.
trans-unit.target: Recursive and applies to whole document tree.

trans-unit.source: For more information about DocumentDB indexing policies, see DocumentDB indexing policies.
trans-unit.target: For more information about DocumentDB indexing policies, see DocumentDB indexing policies.

trans-unit.source: For the purpose of the REST API documentation, all examples use automatic indexing.
trans-unit.target: For the purpose of the REST API documentation, all examples use automatic indexing.

trans-unit.source: The allowable operations on the collection resource are as follows.
trans-unit.target: The allowable operations on the collection resource are as follows.

trans-unit.source: Note that collections cannot be replaced or updated at the moment.
trans-unit.target: Note that collections cannot be replaced or updated at the moment.
